title: Ellen Johnson  Sirleaf  |  Archives of Women's Political Communication

quotes: Born: October 29, 1938 (age 87)
President of Liberia, 2006-2018
where she obtained a master's degree in public administration in 1971
Her entry into politics came in 1972 when she delivered her now-famous commencement address
In 1965, Sirleaf joined the Treasury Department in Liberia
was appointed minister of finance in 1979

After the military coup d'état of 1980, Sirleaf served as president of the Liberian Bank for Development and Investment (LBDI), but fled Liberia and the increasingly suppressive military government that same year.
In 1992, she joined the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)
In 1997, Sirleaf returned to Liberia and participated in the presidential elections.
In 2003, when Charles Taylor was exiled to Nigeria and the National Transitional Government of Liberia (NTGL) was formed, Sirleaf was selected to serve

Sirleaf was born in Monrovia on October 29, 1938.
She grew up in Liberia and attended high school at the College of West Africa in Monrovia.

After the military coup d'état of 1980, Sirleaf served as president of the Liberian Bank for Development and Investment (LBDI), but fled Liberia and the increasingly suppressive military government that same year.
In 1997, Sirleaf returned to Liberia and participated in the presidential elections.
